OK, let’s take an in-depth at the 5 types of customers, and how to deal with different types of customers.

5 Types of Customers

The different types of customers generally fall into 5 different categories. Sure, each client is unique, but for focusing on what matters to your customers, it helps to know about these 5 types of customers:

  • Long-term & loyal customers: They’re the backbone of your business model, the clients who keep coming back because you deliver results. Take your entire client base. Now, figure out which customers comprise half of your sales figures, but less than a quarter of your total client base. Those are the loyal customers. To ensure they stay long-term & loyal, an effective client retention program can help – and TeleDirect offers this service as part of our outbound BPO platform!
  • One and done. Also known as impulse buyers, these clients are the toughest to figure out from the 5 types of customers. In their eyes, your product or service is the most important thing in the world right now, at this moment. Figuring out how to convince them your business’s value and results will help turn this customer into a long-term, profitable relationship!
  • Potential customers. This would-be client if almost ready to purchase – but not yet. To make potential customers some of your most loyal, it helps to have a great lead generation application to find potential customers – and a telesales & upsells platform to capitalize on their enthusiasm!
  • Ready to buy now. Some customers require a bit of persuasion to buy your products and services. Others, like this type of customer, have already made up their minds, so you want to make their transaction as painless as possible. Do you have a streamlined order processing strategy? If not, TeleDirect does, and it’s made to fit any business model, including yours!
  • Bargain basement hunter. Put this type of customers somewhere between the potential customer and the ready to buy now client. They’re too indecisive to buy right now, but might come back tomorrow (or in an hour) ready to seal the deal, especially if you have a discount or special promotion. But don’t lower your price too much – this type of customer, at a low enough cost, will think even you don’t believe in your business!
